div.em: Current conditions as of 24 Apr 08:55 am CDT

div.div: Scattered showers, with thunderstorms also possible after 2pm. Cloudy, with a high near 65. North wind 10 to 15 mph, with gusts as high as 25 mph. Chance of precipitation is 50%. New rainfall amounts of less than a tenth of an inch, except higher amounts possible in thunderstorms.

Isolated showers and thunderstorms before 8pm, then isolated rain between 8pm and 10pm. Mostly cloudy, then gradually becoming mostly clear, with a low around 41. Northwest wind 5 to 15 mph, with gusts as high as 25 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%.
A slight chance of sprinkles after 2pm. Sunny, with a high near 67. North northwest wind 5 to 15 mph, with gusts as high as 25 mph.

div.p:
Lunch Menu for April 27 - May 1
Monday Dunkers
Tuesday Pulled Pork Sandwich
Wednesday Yum Yum
Thursday Deli Sandwich
Friday Peanut Butter and Jelly Sandwich
We will be distributing multiple lunches a day to limit interactions.
Lunches will be distributed on Monday . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Lunch Menu for April 27 - May 1

h3.a: IMPORTANT INFO! NEW DATES TO THE CALENDAR!

div.p:
2019-2020 school year dismissal dates:
May 1st will be the last day for Seniors
May 8th will be the last day for PK-11
Graduation will be July 18th at 4:00PM.
The "ceremony" will be arranged according to whatever recommendations (by the Governor, Commissioner, and South Heartland Health District) are in place at the time. No other dates will be considered for Graduation.

a.aria-label: Read more about IMPORTANT INFO! NEW DATES TO THE CALENDAR!

a.aria-label: Read more about Sutton Secondary Schools - Temporary Distance Learning Plan

div.p: Welcome to Sutton Public Schools where we are “Teaming Up to Educate Our Youth for Future Success.” Our website highlights the great things we offer our K-12 population of students totaling 377, in 2019-2020, NSAA Classification C-2; so we are glad you are visiting! Not only will you gather information as to what our students are learning and participating in, but also you will get a sense of what the community . . .
